name: WPHelpKit
author: WPHelpKit

sections.description:
Create, Organize and Publish help content.

A simple tool for creating Knowledge Base and Documentation sites
for your software products.

HelpKit for documentation sites
is what WooCommerce is for eCommerce sites.

What can I do with HelpKit?

  • Help Center / Support Sites
  • Knowledge Base
  • Documentation
  • User Manuals
  • Wiki
  • FAQs
sections.installation:
• In your WordPress admin dashboard navigate to the Plugins > Add New.
  • Search for “WPHelpKit”
  • Click the “Install” button.
sections.faq:
How to get started?

Upon activation, the plugin will add a new page named “HelpKit” which will serve as the index for all your help articles.

Where do I find the Settings / Customization options

All settings and customization option can be found in Appearance > Customize > Helpkit.

How to add Help articles?

In your WordPress administration dashboard, go to HelpKit > Add New

How to reorder help articles and categories

Open up the HelpKit page via Appearance > Customize and start draging and dropping help article or categories direcly in the livew preview of the Customizer.

0.9.2

  • New: Index tree navigation added to help articles and categories
  • New: Option to redirect category to first article
  • New: Option to search current category Only
  • New: Search by tags

0.9.1

  • New: Category descriptions added to HelpKit index page;
  • New: Category descriptions added for sub-categories;
  • New: Help Article excerpts added to the category archives;
  • New in PRO: Assign category images / thumbs;

0.9.0

  • Initial Release

short_description: Create a fully featured Help Center site (Knowledge Base, Documentation, Wiki, FAQs) with WordPress.
